title: I understand that lee needs a buff, but I feel like if youre going to buff R
body:
You should buff scaling rather than base.

200 base damage increase is the kind of thing that makes heavy tank oriented lee builds stupid to face because he's going to be dealing prett hard-hitting damage while being hard to kill (his kit inherently makes him slippier as all hell as well).

I'd rather have lee invest in damage to deal damage than have high base damages.

In the situation I was referring to I meant that Lee SIn doesn't just "get" 2 dashes, and I did not say that we should ignore them either. Lee's Q is a situational dash onto a target that was previously hit by his Q, his W requires an ally or ally ward to utilize. I'm not saying these dashes aren't worth anything or that they're hard to use, but there ARE times when they cannot be accessed, especially compared to any champion who's dash is actually on demand.


Whether anyone likes it or not, Lee's dashes require a small amount of resources and/or risks to use properly and THAT was my point, they aren't just free things he can use willy nilly, he needs to know what's around him and what's available to him. I'm not saying it's the most thought-provoking gameplay, but it does require more than anyone is giving credit for.

Now finally,
When you hear "hyper mobile champion with tons of dashes" what do you often think? Yasuo, probably?

What makes the difference between him and lee? Lee bursts, Yasuo is a DPS.
Both have many dashes, both are manaless (though lee uses Energy, if you're auto attacking anyone at all it's still better than a mana champ), Both have an ultimate that can temporarily hinder the enemy team's movement [Yasuo holds them, Lee knocks them up]

The difference is that lee requires moderation of your abilities. You cant smash them and win, you have to think before you press because every one of them costs 50 first cast and 30 second, with a 200 limit without ignoring auto attacks etc.

But herein lies the rub
If you moderate your usage of abilities, you will be *stronger* than yasuo for early, and roughly equal for the rest of the game. 
And yasuo, coming from someone who played him a fair bit before diving into ranked, is pretty frickin' strong.

I agree with this as well as a lee main. 
However, do understand Lee is primarily a fighter/diver, not an assassin nor a tank. With the removal of green smite lowering his overall ward count he is more like this than ever.

 My personal opinion would be to change his E and R to have scaling off of total AD, rather than bonus AD. This allows him to retain his fighter characteristics, allowing him to be beefy without being a tank, forcing to build damage still without forcing him to build assassin items
Lee likes CDR, but most AD CDR items are assassin items (barring Black Cleaver and Warrior) and one of his usual builds revolves around a beefier style already by building titanic and steraks.

tl;dr: We want him to be a diver/fighter as it will allow him to still be a threat and dive, as well as having some sustained fighting power without 100-0 squishies as an assassin.

Of all the comments on here this one makes the most sense. Most fighters tend to have total ad scaling so that if they want to build damage they need to invest heavily in it, if not they'll still do decent damage while still managing to survive in fights and won't always delete the squishies
